title: Creating a new email to handle support?
body:
I have a support ticket open for an account ban and it was requested that we (the support and I) communicate through an email address that's not associated with any accounts. Why? That makes zero sense to me. There has been nothing to validate that I'm the account owner yet (besides login and hitting "submit ticket").

   It's been 3 days and I feel there hasn't been any leeway made on recovering the account. So far all that's been done is I had to create a new email address. Why can't this be handled in house through the support tickets?

Ticket #31372892

replies.body: There's a possibility in some cases than the unauthorized user also has access to your email, so it's a security check.  This is why we generally ask players to use our [account recovery form](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/requests/new?ticket_form_id=72416) instead.  I see your reply was sent about 20 minutes, give your specialist some time to review things and he'll get back to you as soon as possible.  Good luck!

I understand that I replied recently; that's not the concern.

"There's a possibility in some cases than the unauthorized user also has access to your email, so it's a security check."
> Gets bypassed when I haven't been validated as the account owner yet. What if I were the unauthorized user trying to recover the account and just handed over an email address?

You would still need to be able to answer the recovery questions and verification processed by your account specialist.  The email is one step, but not an ultimate game changer.  Reach out to your account specialist, and he'll be able to offer more context specific to your case as well!

Why couldn't that have been handled in the support ticket section without involving email?

It just seems like an extra step that shouldn't been there. I'm 99% sure it's because I logged in while in another state.
